text: Georgia competed in the Winter Olympic Games as an independent country for the first time at the 1994 Winter Olympics in Lillehammer, Norway. == Alpine skiing == ;Men {|class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="5"|Final |- !Run 1 !Run 2 !Run 3 !Total !Rank |- |rowspan=2|Zurab Dzhidzhishvili |Super-G |colspan=3 bgcolor="wheat"| |align="center"|1:53.27 !align="center"|47 |- |Combined |align="center"|1:42.44 |align="center"|DNF |align="center"| |align="center" colspan=2|Did Not Finish |- |Levan Abramishvili |Slalom |align="center"|DNF |align="center"| |colspan=1 bgcolor="wheat"| |align="center" colspan=2|Did Not Finish |} == Luge == {|class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="6"|Final |- !Run 1 !Run 2 !Run 3 !Run 4 !Total !Rank |- |Levan Tibilov Kakha Vakhtangishvili |Doubles |align="center"|49.880 |align="center"|49.504 |align="center" colspan=2 bgcolor="wheat"| |align="center"|1:39.384 !align="center"|17 |} == Ski jumping == {|class="wikitable" style="font- size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|First Round !colspan="3"|Final |- !Points !Rank !Points !Total !Rank |- |rowspan=2|Kakha Tsakadze |Large hill |align="center"|28.5 |align="center"|52 |align="center"|34.4 |align="center"|62.9 !align="center"|55 |- |Normal hill |align="center"|83.5 |align="center"|53 |align="center"|73.0 |align="center"|156.5 !align="center"|50 |} ==References== *Official Olympic Reports Category:Nations at the 1994 Winter Olympics 1994 Winter
title: Georgia at the 1994 Winter Olympics
